title: Inevitable Religiosity and My Pragmatic Darwinian Pascal's Wager
description:
Atheists are waking up to the fact that religion is available. Coleman Hughes with John McWhorter notes Dr. King's reliance on religion. Bret Weinstein according to Alister McGrath thinks we almost need a new religion. Auguste Comte tried exactly this but if we compare it to what Joseph Smith did it was a failure. Why? 

How then must we define religion? How did Paul Tillich define it? We go back to Jordan Peterson at Lafayette College and questions about religion. It's inevitable. We'll look at why CS Lewis picked Christianity. Charles Taylor's "fullness". Byrne Power's cheap "fun" in America and finally what I think of as a Pragmatic Darwinian Pascal's Wager. 

Coleman Hughes and John McWhorter https://youtu.be/UPiNiTwf5bM
Bret Weinstein and Alister McGrath https://youtu.be/kRx2uNMJFnU
Auguste Comte School of Life Sociology https://youtu.be/OhVamhT4Q3s
Auguste Comte Tom Richey https://youtu.be/OhVamhT4Q3s
Sam Harris JBP Vancouver 1 https://youtu.be/d-Z9EZE8kpo
John Vervaeke Awakening from the Meaning Crisis https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=54l8_ewcOlY&list=PLND1JCRq8Vuh3f0P5qjrSdb5eC1ZfZwWJ
Paul Tillich Ultimate Concern https://youtu.be/M_HcFLa0b1Q
Jordan Peterson on Religion at Lafayette College https://youtu.be/V32WHDuy-Do
CS Lewis in Sheldon VanAuken a Severe Mercy https://amzn.to/2RxEnZX
Tim Keller Making Sense of God https://amzn.to/30XTij0
Byrne Power and the Divination of Fun https://youtu.be/ELo279fyc3Y
Byrne Power's Channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIAtCuzdvgNJvSYILnHtdWA
Charles Taylor A Secular Age https://amzn.to/36sQbkf
CS Lewis Mere Christianity https://amzn.to/2RvpQxR
Unbelievable Justin Brierley Peter Kreeft CS Lewis Argument from Desire https://www.premierchristianradio.com/Shows/Saturday/Unbelievable/Episodes/Peter-Kreeft-debates-the-argument-from-desire-Unbelievable
Tom Holland Dominion https://amzn.to/313LKeL
